JavaSort in and algorithem that is used in the Java programming language by calling the java.util.Arrays.sort() method. For Java version >= 7.0 this method uses several checks to determine the best way to sort the data. If most cases the method will use a variation of a quick sort algorithm, the so called Yaroslavskiy Dual-Pivot Quicksort algorithm. For details about this method see a documented Java 7 or Java 8 source code on grepcode page.

Time complexity: an average time complexity of the algorithm is \( \Theta(n \log(n)) \) while the worst-time complexity is \( \Theta(n^2). \)
